"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5502f0e3636872655e7e0f00#post_5502f0e3636872655e7e0f00
Joking aside I never understood why mass media tries to make everything kid friendly or why people seem to think that toning down franchises to be kid friendly makes them better.  Making sexual franchises or such toned down to make something kid friendly makes about as much sense as if someone were to try to make a fifty shades of gray movie for kids (If someone were to try this I bet chris hansen would be knocking on the producer's home door).

topics.body:
Imagine fairy tale characters coming to reality.
And then, they act nothing like in the books.

Dorothy, an expert street fighter that had killed 500 flying baboons in a single battle. She was transported when enjoying the countryside instead of the city life where she would beat up gang members and force them to pay with money or blood. She made allies with the Tin Man; a man forced to wear an indestructible suit of armor, Lion; a _lion_ that had been thrown out of the circus and Scarecrow; who is pretty much a hobo. She is widely known as "Red Shoes" Dorothy.

Snow White, an young girl with important relations that is forced to flee from her power-hungry step mother. She later lived in a rundown apartment near the woods at the edge of town. She is also guarded by the "Seven Dwarves", a group of bodyguards in suits that are only called "dwarves" because they dwarf those around them. They protect her and sometimes steal money if given the chance.

Mary Poppins, a witch that travels to a dysfunctional family as a sign of gratitude to a similar witch that helped her and gave her magic. She acts as a nanny and make the children's lives terrible in order to teach them how to mature and protect themselves from dangerous investors and slavers. Their father, George, was a knight at the Banks Order, ruled by the Grandmaster Dawes. He was thrown out after making a mistake that jeopardized the Order. Using the magic words taught to him by Mary Poppins; ‚ÄúSupercalifragilisticexpialidocious‚Äù, Grandmaster Dawes died the other day due to uncontrollable laughter. His son discovered that his father was cursed and rehired George as he needed as many knights as he can due to the loss of morale.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
